entry.title: [ SavedTabGroups ] Fix out of order groups on restart
entry.content:
Fixes a bug where saving then unsaving a group would not update the

ModelTypeStore (local storage) with all the updated positions of the

groups. This causes the groups to be displayed out of order when the

browser is restarted.

entry.title: Do not empty brace-initialize scoped_refptr<> members.
entry.content:
It is redundant since scoped_refptr must be null upon creation to

avoid stray ref-count writes upon destruction, and this form may

not do what one expects vis-a-vis `T* member_{};` depending

upon the implementation of a given smart pointer class.



These were the two hits from

https://source.chromium.org/search?q=pcre:yes%20scoped_refptr%3C%5B%5E;%7B%5D*%7B%7D;%20%20-file:%2Fgen



Change-Id: I17f08e766a0e51b9a41208428be0b2821c995ab4

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4670625

entry.title: [LCPP] HTMLPreloadScanner prioritize requests that matches ElementLocator
entry.content:
This CL modifies `HTMLPreloadScanner` to take `ElementLocator`s

so it could annotate the matching `PreloadRequest` that they are

potentially from lcp element.



The `IsPotentiallyLCPElement` annotation is plumbed through

`FetchParameters`, so they could be claimed at

`ResourceFetcher::ComputeLoadPriority()`.



Bug: 1419756

entry.title: [BestEffortServiceWorker] Support dedupe for subresources
entry.content:
This CL adds a minimal dedupe support for subresource requests when the

BestEffortServiceWorker is enabled.



What ServiceWorkerSubresourceLoader does in this CL is almost same as

what ServiceWorkerMainResourceLoader is doing, passing a custom

URLLoaderFactory from renderer to ServiceWorker thread.



This basically works for most cases except for the case when a redirect

happens. Currently redirect responses happened in RaceNetworkRequest are

successfully returned to the browser/renderer side, but those are not

forwarded to fetch handlers. It may lead an inconsistent cache state in

some scenarios. This will be addressed in a follow-up.



Bug: 1420517

Change-Id: I029f5670cb07b5998b6f07a7efd86b074635827c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4668647

entry.title: arc: Fix composing by Android IME
entry.content:
This CL fixes the two issues which breaks composing by Android IME.

- InputMethodEngine::SetComposition()'s |selection_start| and

|selection_end| is relative to the beginning of the composition.

The previous implementation passes the index in whole text.

- InputConnectionImpl calls InputMethodEngine::SetCompositionRange to

set composing region, but it doesn't allow to set composing region

outside of selection/cursor. InputMethodEngine::SetComposingRange

should be used instead.



Bug: 288991314

Test: manual

Change-Id: If0594c5cc599e9c54dfbe8bf07ce91588c13827f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4661829

entry.title: [phrase-line-break] Move strictness to `LazyLineBreakIterator`
entry.content:
This patch adds `LazyLineBreakIterator::SetStrictness()` by

moving the strictness logic from `ComputedStyle`.



Before this patch, `NGLineBreaker` sets styles by two ways:

1. Directly to `LazyLineBreakIterator`.

2. Get a locale with LDML[1] keywords from `ComputedStyle`,

which calls `LayoutLocale` to compute it, and set it to

`LazyLineBreakIterator`.



When the phrase line breaking requires another LDML keyword,

the second route will be more complicated. To simplify this

route, this patch does:

1. `NGLineBreaker` converts `LineBreak` to

`LineBreakStrictness`. `NGLineBreaker` already does other

conversions from core types to platform types.

2. `LazyLineBreakIterator::SetStrictness()` computes the LDML

keyword internally.



This patch should have no behavior changes.



[1] https://www.unicode.org/reports/tr35/



Bug: 1443291

Change-Id: Ifa82f7a0a637e7fb1e8df859cb362e93501a3389

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4667043

itself.

triggering the next step. This makes the function more readable, and

allows easy integration with point 1.

entry.title: [anchor-position] Implement 'position-fallback-bounds'
entry.content:
This patch implements the 'position-fallback-bounds' property by:

(1) Also checking the additional fallback-bounds rect in

NGOutOfFlowLayoutParts::CalculateOffset()

(2) Also keep track of the scroll offset of the additional bounds rect

in AnchorScrollData, and use that as an input (1)

(3) Augments the existing non-overflowing scroll range structure with

an additional range (see the NonOverflowingScrollRange struct) to

help determine whether the additional fallback-bounds rect is

overflown.



Spec: https://drafts.csswg.org/css-anchor-position-1/#fallback-bounds



Fixed: 1455557

entry.title: [Extensions] Create service worker dispatch to ack time metric.
entry.content:
This metric records the time it takes from dispatch to the event router

to the time when the browser receives an ack (over IPC) from the

service worker renderer that it fired the event.



This is meant as an overall metric that can have multiple sub-metrics

pulled out from it in the future. But is a good starting point.

entry.title: [Android Bulk Tab Edit] Hide selection editor if share intent succeeds
entry.content:
Check if a broadcasted share intent was received by another app when using the share tabs feature in the tab selection editor. If detected, then exit the selection editor otherwise leave it open with the current tabs remaining selected.



A recording of a demo can be found here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1R8oJWe_WTFAfc1X_Cbq5g3Nl1G56KQLH/view?usp=sharing

entry.title: Hovercard memory usage should only include the main frame PMF estimate
entry.content:
Currently hovercard memory usage could be misleading since it includes

memory usage from BF caches and pre-rendered frames. This could also

lead to high memory value to be triggered more often and possibly on

the wrong site. This change ensures the estimate only includes the main

frame of the page node.

entry.title: [Color correction] Only log color correction settings when enabled
entry.content:
Previously color correction settings (filter type and amount) were

logged even if color correction was disabled, but this creates some

noise in the logs since most users do not turn on color correction.

With this change, we log the settings only if color correction

is enabled.

entry.title: Parallelize GPU pixel tests
entry.content:
Enables parallelization in the GPU pixel tests. This affects all

Linux/Mac/Windows configs except for NVIDIA and Debug Mac builders

since slow Mac configs seem to have flakiness issues.



Sample speedups:



AMD Macbook Release: 9m38s -> 5m10s (1.86x speedup)

M2 Macbook Release: 6m45s -> 3m11s (2.12x speedup)

Windows Intel Release: 6m6s -> 3m7s (1.96x speedup)

Windows NVIDIA Release: 5m36s -> 2m24s (2.33x speedup)

Windows NVIDIA Debug: 8m19s -> 4m35s (1.81x speedup)

Linux Intel Release: 6m19s -> 3m40s (1.72x speedup)

Linux NVIDIA Release: 4m25s -> 1m39s (2.68x speedup)

Linux NVIDIA Debug: 6m51s -> 4m22s (1.57x speedup)



Bug: 1340607

entry.title: Allow input type date etc to have vertical writign mode
entry.content:
This CL allows types "date", "datetime-local", "month", "time",

"week" to have writing-mode vertical for both the default native

appearance and when appearance is set to none.



We also put the change behind the feature flag

FormControlsVerticalWritingModeSupport so it can be turned on safely.



Note that, for direction RTL, the calendar picker (for both horizontal

and vertical writing mode) is currently only on the right side. That

change will be tackled by issue 1432009.

entry.title: [Service Workers] Consolidate Update() methods
entry.content:
There are currently two overloads of both

ServiceWorkerContextCore::UpdateServiceWorker() and

ServiceWorkerJobCoordinator::Update(). Despite leading to the same

endpoint (pushing a new ServiceWorkerRegisterJobBase to the queue),

these overloads have independent implementations (one does not call

into the other), which makes it easy to potentially update only one

with behavior that should apply generally.



Make this easier by:

* Providing default parameters on

ServiceWorkerContextCore::UpdateServiceWorker() and removing the

second version of the method.

* Removing the now-unnecessary version of

ServiceWorkerJobCoordinator::Update().



As part of this, also explicitly have all callers specify an empty

FetchClientSettingsObject() when one would be implicitly created.

Since this should only be done in cases where it's a browser-

initiated update, it makes sense to have callers handle that directly

(as opposed to having that detail buried in the implementation).



Bug: None

Change-Id: I14f6121fc96f832d63892cd9a63863c8269b3ffb

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4661391

Commit-Queue: Devlin Cronin

Reviewed-by: Yoshisato Yanagisawa

entry.title: cros_next: Fix bar animation when jelly is on
entry.content:
This fixes a use-after-free (UAF) bug in the desk mini view removal

animation when it is combined with the bar slide animation. The root

cause of the bug is that when the mini view removal animation is

triggered but not yet finished, and at the same time the bar view is

removed, the mini view animation ends up trying to use a dangling

pointer.



The fix is to add an abort handler to the mini view. This handler will

abort the mini view's ongoing animation if the mini view is removed or

if a new animation is triggered.



It also fixes a bunch of flaky browser tests.



Bug: b/289530755, b/290106345, b/289525498, b/287680276

Test: DesksClientTest.{RecallSavedDesk,SystemUILaunchMultipleDeskTemplates,SaveEmptyDesk,SaveActiveDesk}

entry.title: Enable the consistently passing tests in SharedStorageManagerErrorParamTest
entry.content:
This change is part of the effort to re-enable consistently passing

tests across the entire chromium.

If the tests are reasonable, please LGTM and I will proceed to submit

the change.

If the tests are unreasonable, please let me know and I will remove

them.



I do not inspect each individual test case, the idea is to run the

disabled tests on reviver builders

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/g/reviver/builders and use the

aggregated results to decide if a previously disabled test is now

consistently passing.



To inspect the result of the runs, you may choose a platform you are

interested, e.g. chromium/reviver/lacros-coordinator.

[link: https://ci.chromium.org/p/chromium/builders/reviver/lacros-coordinator]

In the baseline builder / buildbucket.schedule step, e.g.

chromium/ci/linux-lacros-builder-rel - buildbucket.schedule,

there will be a luci run link.

[ex: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/reviver/runner/b8776966777608450081/overview]



Meanwhile, the aggregated results are used to create the change.

And the following list shows how many times the changed tests were

*consistently* passing on the relevant builders.



components:components_unittests/SharedStorageManagerErrorParamTest.InitFailure_DestroyAndRecreateDatabase/All.InMemoryOnly

137 fuchsia-fyi-arm64-dbg

158 fuchsia-fyi-x64-dbg

191 fuchsia-x64-rel

110 linux-lacros-tester-rel

components:components_unittests/SharedStorageManagerErrorParamTest.OtherOperationResults_NoErrorsAdded/All.FileBacked

137 fuchsia-fyi-arm64-dbg

158 fuchsia-fyi-x64-dbg

191 fuchsia-x64-rel

110 linux-lacros-tester-rel

entry.content:
With some recent changes, the CardboardRenderer was now being created

before the SDK was initialized. This moves the initialization of the

Cardboard SDK to before anything else is created from the SDK.

entry.title: Fenced frames: Add console error granularity to the reportEvent API.
entry.content:
Previously, all scenarios in which reports were not sent were logged to

the console as errors, but not all cases are actually an error. For

instance, if a buyer wants to have an event reported to the seller, but

the seller has not registered a URL for reporting, the buyer has no way

of knowing that is the case, so this is "intended behavior". For cases

like these, we'll log a warning instead.



Fixed: 1456229

entry.title: Move navigation context to the AttributionDataHostManager
entry.content:
Context on the navigation is currently stored in the AttributionHost. To

process navigation tied source registrations coming from the

browser process, the navigation context is needed in the manager.



To make this change, we create a SourceRegistration when the navigation

starts instead of waiting for some data before doing so.



A new `NotifyNavigationRegistrationCompleted` is also added. This

ensures that the AttributionDataHostManager always has an opportunity

to cleanup the context created on `Started`.



There is small behavior change where the input event associated with a

data host is determined at a different time (DidStartNavigation vs

RegisterDataHost). This should not be problematic: both methods are

called at a small interval, it is logical to tie the input event to the

navigation & it ensures that the foreground and background registrations

use the same input event.



There are additional benefits:

- Uses less memory by storing the context once in the data_host instead

of storing in the AttributionHost and the AttributionDataHostManager.

- Fixes ineligible data host cleanup. Currently, if

`RegisterNavigationDataHost` is called but not

`NotifyNavigationRegistrationStarted` the map will never be cleared.

This is due to early returns that were added in https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4402808

- Avoids a memory leak where a SourceRegistration is never completed

because the last response in a redirect chain is coming from a non

suitable reporting origin (i.e. NotifyNavigationRegistrationData is

never called with `is_final_response=true`).



Bug: 1374121

Change-Id: Ia776edb245e160483cd6e458019b947c8426182e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4616853

Reviewed-by: Nan Lin

entry.title: Check UrgentPageDiscarding feature on memory pressure.
entry.content:
Check UrgentPageDiscarding feature on memory pressure, instead of at

policy creation time. This ensures that only clients that would have

discarded a page are enrolled in the experiment. Without this change,

experiment groups include a lot of users that are not meaningully

affected by the experiment.

entry.title: multipaste: Make delete button appear on top of clipboard history items
entry.content:
This CL changes the clipboard history item view hierarchy so that the

contents view and the delete button are siblings under a FillLayout

rather than parent and child. Now, when the delete button becomes

visible, the contents view will retain its full size rather than shrink

to give horizontal space to the delete button. This change improves the

experience of multi-line text labels (forthcoming) and will be made even

better when the contents view is also masked when the delete button is

visible (also forthcoming).



Screenshot: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3p9j6ADnsQYuZMg

entry.title: [fuzz coverage] Remote coverage.py dependency from merge_all_fuzzers.py.
entry.content:
The profdata file that coverage.py *exports* is different than what it

uses to generate coverage locally, causing a divergence in behavior of

the local coverage script and the recipe run for coverage in automation.



Plus, coverage.py is far too heavyweight for what we need anyway.



Replace coverage.py with a simple llvm-profdata merge command.

entry.title: fwupd: Add feature flag to disable fwupd client
entry.content:
fwupd client restarted powerd services which may not be

wanted for specific tests. This flag introduces a way to

ensure that fwupd_client is not initialized during those

entry.title: redaction_tool: Fix a SSID pattern truncating Net logs issue
entry.content:
The original regex causing the truncation was: (\\* SSID=)(.+)($).



The reason was the regex matching has enabled multiple-lines option.

All the lines after the SSID line will then be treated as part of the

SSID.



Change it to "(\\* SSID=)([^\n]+)(.*)" so that SSID part will stop

taking characters once encountering a newline.

entry.title: [Autofill] Fix dangling raw_ptr in TestRecipeReplayer
entry.content:
The raw_ptr TestRecipeReplayer::browser_ is dangling at the time of

~TestRecipeReplayer() because the browser is closed at the time already.



This CL fixes this by destroying the TestRecipeReplayer in the test's

TearDownOnMainThread(), when the browser still exists.



As a by-product, this merges

- TestRecipeReplayer::Setup() into TestRecipeReplayer() and

- TestRecipeReplayer::Cleanup() into ~TestRecipeReplayer().

top/left. The accelerators should always match physical left/top to

match the shortcut viewer text. This patch sends out a snap secondary

event if we hit the left/top accelerator and the display is upside down,

and vice versa for right/bottom accelerator.

entry.title: [iOS][finch-first-run] Add metric for FRE seed application
entry.content:
This CL adds a new metric to track the stage of iOS first run

variations seed fetching and application. This is done for two

purposes:



1. Check the percentage of Finchable FRE on iOS executions that

actually leads to a seed being applied on first run.



2. Enables long term monitoring of Finchable FRE on iOS. Ideally, this

metric should be fired for all iOS FRE instances with FRE finchability

enabled, so the total count of this metric of each experiment group in

any study should be similar. If all metrics are fired from the default

group, it means that the seed is not applied and the FRE finchability

feature is somehow broken. A Chirp notification subscription of this

metric on a never ending study (Uniformity studies, for example) will

be used, so iOS team members get email notifications when the feature

breaks, instead of having to proactively running manual performance

checks.



More info: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ccbTmluBJEdizBGaIhPHug5JZ9wF0jDg08TfUF1qvds/edit?usp=sharing



IOSChromeVariationsSeedStore is expanded to keep track of first run

stage. Since more static variables and APIs are introduced, a test

suite is added to verify the integration between the native seed store

and the core variations service.



Bug: 1458395

Change-Id: I7a8c0bf607d465b913a299399f677cdfd89201f3

2023-06-30 jsobczak@google.com Specialize ExceptionOr

> ExceptionOr::ok() returns true if the value is set. This can be misleading

> for boolean types.

> ExceptionOr result = SomeFunction();

> if (result.ok()) {

> if (result.result() {

> // Case 1: SomeFunction returned true

> } else {

> // Case 2: SomeFunction returned false

> } else {

> // Case 3: SomeFunction returned an exception

> }

> It's easy to overlook case 2.

> The specialized ExceptionOr::ok() returns false in Case 2, which allows

> us to write:

> if (result) {

> // SomeFunction returned true

> } else {

> // SomeFunction returned false or an exception

> // result.GetException() can be used if we need to handle different exceptions

> // differenty

> }

>

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 544715641

>
